ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] EQIM: EverQuest Instant Messaging
ygData.msgSnippet: MessageBut they are No drop and that was my point. And I have played since it went live. And yes I will complain about this game. Service has dropped and the
ygData.messageBody:
Message
But they are No drop and that was my point. And I have played since it went live. And yes I will complain about this game. Service has dropped and the price has gone up. It all started with the Stormhammer server and has gone downhill from there.
 
----- Original Message -----
From: alexander.jones@...
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Thursday, November 07, 2002 6:36 AM
Subject: RE: [EverQuest] EQIM: EverQuest Instant Messaging

Yes the vendor bought are no drop.
 
But as I said...not many pop spells are vendorbought, they are dropspells. And the dropspells are NOT NO DROP.
-----Original Message-----
From: Jerry O'Connor [mailto:dsnywrldlvr@...]
Sent: den 7 november 2002 13:06
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Subject: RE: [EverQuest] EQIM: EverQuest Instant Messaging

The new spells for PoK are no drop. You go to a vender in the great library and buy them but they are no drop.

 "LAINE. Mikael (Nol)" <laine@...> wrote:

Heh, didn't know that, also heard that they are nodrop. Well, guess i should have learned not to listen to people unless i know they know what they are talking 'bout.
 
Underligt va folk förväntar sig få gratis. Tycker det är skumt att folk inte är glada att dom får så mycket nytt för så lite stålar.
-----Original Message-----
From: alexander.jones@... [mailto:alexander.jones@...]
Sent: den 7 november 2002 09:02
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Subject: RE: [EverQuest] EQIM: EverQuest Instant Messaging

look, spells arent no drop. Get your facts straight.
 
The parchments that drop are no drop. These parchments are turned in to recieve a spell from each guildmaster. So if you want a ranger spell you turn in to ranger guildmaster. You get a random spell, the spell isnt no drop....
 
So dont go around bashing for nothing.
-----Original Message-----
From: Orion [mailto:orionv@...]
Sent: den 6 november 2002 21:09
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [EverQuest] EQIM: EverQuest Instant Messaging

Also consider POP....with all other expansions new spells could be bought and sold/given to those that did not get the expansion but in POP bought spells are No drop.
----- Original Message -----
From: Minigamer
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Wednesday, November 06, 2002 1:19 PM
Subject: RE: [EverQuest] EQIM: EverQuest Instant Messaging

Maybe but I have to disagree for some business
reasoning.  If you look at any company that has
released new versions, they always tailor the SWITCH
from one to antother.  For instance, D&D 2nd edition
had a good following and most said they would stick
with it.  WOTC marketed the 3rd edition in such a way
that most have now switched to that version. 

I would think that at first EQ2 will be promoted with
the hint of EQ being supported but I think once the
bugs are worked out that it will be hard pushed.
Another analogy is Luclin. When it first came out,
most did not ever think of getting it.  I for one had
it, and uninstalled it.  But then BAM I give you the
Bazaar.

Now ask yourself who does not have it. I see more
people without Kunark and Velius than people who don't
have Luclin now.

BUT time will tell, I am sure EQ2 will get a great
following. After all i! ts business and marketing.
Enjoy
--- Kyle Daigle <kyledaigletemp@...> wrote:
> The fear of loosing EQ for EQ2. honestly, I'm not
> really even sure which
> way I'm going with that.  I don't believe EQ will
> die with EQ2 comes
> out.  I believe both games will hold their ground.
> At the beginning of
> EQ2 it will get some major attention but I think EQ
> will recoup after
> that.  Only time will tell.
> 
> Kyle Daigle
>

> spells in POP are Nodrop,etc.. Getting really tired
